title: Nothing Is Forever 12
body:
Pairing: Steve Rogers x Sick!Reader

Warning: Reader has a life threatening illness. Mentions of wanting to die. Hospital trips. Seriously sick moments. Mentions of miscarriage. Mentions of losing baby. Language. Self hate. Secrets. Sass, lots of sass.

A/N: Reader is Peter’s sister, They’re adopted by Tony and Pepper, who have Howie as well. So She’s Peter and Howie’s younger sister. Just a heads up.

Tag List Is Open!!

The knock on the door told them Mae had arrived. Nat was the first one to the door, Becca scurried down the stairs quickly to greet her friend. Buck stood next to the bottom of the stairs and Steve leaned against the opening of the living room. When the door opened, Howie looks frazzled and Mae looks sad.

“Hey Mae.” Nat’s hand closes around the back of Mae’s head as she hugs Nat’s waist. “You okay?” She looks down at the mini version of Y/N.

“I guess.” Mae shrugs, before her and Becca rush up the stairs together. Her overnight bag left at the bottom of the stairs.

“She should perk up.” Howie licks his lips nervously. “It was a rough morning.” He shrugs. He was jittery, almost nervous.

“Did something happen?” Buck asks, watching Howie nervously scratch the back of his head.

“Oh um, no.” He shakes his head.

“Nothing?” Steve wanders up behind Nat. “You sure Howie, you look nervous.” He eyes Y/N’s brother.

“Nope.” Howie shakes his head, pushing his mouth together. “Just um, tired.” He nods.

“Hey you wouldn’t know where Y/N is, she’s not returning my texts.” He asks casually. Howie swallows hard, clearly struggling.

“I think um, she was busy this afternoon.” Howie replies to his shoes.

“Busy?” Nat asks.

“Mhm.” Howie nods. “Well I should go. I have a few things to do.” He jerks his thumb back towards his car.

“Hey,” Buck steps forward “is that a visitor sticker?” He lifts the open edge of Howie’s jacket.

“Oh that’s, that’s old.” Howie scrambles. Nat yanks the sticker off, reading it over.

“Howard it’s dated today.” Buck looks from the sticker to Howie. Howie shifts, guilt washing over his face.

“With Y/N’s name under patient.” Nat turns the sticker around showing Howie.

“Crap, she’s going to kill me.” Howie groans.

“What’s wrong with her, Howie.” Steve pleads. Nat pulls him into the house, Buck kicks the door shut and he’s trapped instantly with them.





“I need one month.” Banner nods, standing at the foot of the bed. “We’ll get your meds set and you can take surgery off the table.” He looks between you and Peter. Peter was rather thrilled you agreed to regular medication, since you’d been so adamant about not having the surgery.

“One month.” You nod. You could do one month, that wasn’t so bad. Your brothers, Mae would come visit. You could get someone to cover your cheer squad for the short time. It wasn’t ideal, but you could make it work at the very least.

“Medical stay. You stay, we test meds, get you feeling good enough to go home again.” He nods.

“Shit.” You groan. “We have to detox.” You grumble. It was your least favorite part of changing meds. It was going through withdrawal, mood swings, all the symptoms you had of your illness would come back in full swing and your only choice was to hang on and ride it out.

“Yes, you have to start fresh. Plus we know some that work best for you already.” He smiles softly.

“Alright.” You sigh. “I just need stuff from home.” You look over at your brother. He was practically beaming with joy. You wanted to slap him, but you understood.

“I’ll pack a bag.” He nods, grinning at you. “By the time I’m back, you’ll be admitted, in your room and we can have dinner together.” He grabs hold of your hand.

“Chinese?” You smile.

“I’ll grab a bag and take out.” Peter nods laughing.

“I’ll order the methadone to be administered after. Get ready it’s going to be a very long night for you.” Banner smiles. You look over at Peter.

“Make it a large order.” You nod. He laughs, getting up kissing your forehead, he hurries from the room.





“I can’t tell you anything.” Howie shrugs, putting up a front.

“Can’t?” Nat lifts a brow.

“Won’t.” Howie quickly changes his words. “I’m a vault.” He nods. Steve and Bucky exchange a look.

“Howie, speak or I’m going to wail on you, again, for fun.” Buck grins, folding his arms over his broad chest.

“Hey!” Howie steps back. “I paid for hitting on Nat.” He shifts.

“Did you, really?” Buck scratches his chin. “I don’t remember.” Buck smirks.

“I really should have told Peter to drop her off.” Howie scraps a hand down his face.

“Yeah, you should have.” Steve steps towards him.

“Hey,” Howie looks nervous “we helped you. Told you she still wants you.” Howie points a finger at his chest.

“Why does she need me? Why do you need me for her?” Steve steps closer to Howie.

“See, that, that I can’t tell you.” Howie shakes his head, rubbing the back of his neck.

“I’m going to hit you.” Buck nods.

“What? Why?” Howie’s eyes grow wide.

“Can’t tell you that.” Steve smirks.

“You think, cause you two,” Howie waves a finger between Steve and Bucky “are all big, with the good hair and blue eyes, you’re intimidating.” He scuffs. “You don’t scare me, Y/N she scars me.” He nods. Buck and Steve exchange a look, nodding. He grabs Howie by the front of his jacket, pulling him up off his feet.

“Boy, you’re tall. I forgot, how you get all, you know.” Howie nods, nervously looking at Steve’s hands gripping his jacket. There’s a faint noise suddenly.

“Are you, vibrating?” Nat squints at Howie. Buck slaps a hand over his face, shaking his head.

“It’s my phone.” Howie nods, looking from them to him. “I need to check that.” He adds. “It’s about Y/N.” Steve sighs.

“Fine.” He sets Howie down. They watch as he pulls his phone out, quickly reading over whatever texts were sent to him. When he’s done he nods. He looks at Steve, watching him for a moment.

“You love her?” Howie wasn’t really asking a question, it was more of a statement.

“Since we were sixteen. You know that Howie.” Steve sighs, running a hand through his hair.

“Sit down big guy, I’m about to rock your world.” Howie sighs, patting Steve on the shoulder.

The knock on the door told them Mae had arrived. Nat was the first one to the door, Becca scurried down the stairs quickly to greet her friend. Buck stood next to the bottom of the stairs and Steve leaned against the opening of the living room. When the door opened, Howie looks frazzled and Mae looks sad.

“Hey Mae.” Nat’s hand closes around the back of Mae’s head as she hugs Nat’s waist. “You okay?” She looks down at the mini version of Y/N.

“I guess.” Mae shrugs, before her and Becca rush up the stairs together. Her overnight bag left at the bottom of the stairs.

“She should perk up.” Howie licks his lips nervously. “It was a rough morning.” He shrugs. He was jittery, almost nervous.

“Did something happen?” Buck asks, watching Howie nervously scratch the back of his head.

“Oh um, no.” He shakes his head.

“Nothing?” Steve wanders up behind Nat. “You sure Howie, you look nervous.” He eyes Y/N’s brother.

“Nope.” Howie shakes his head, pushing his mouth together. “Just um, tired.” He nods.

“Hey you wouldn’t know where Y/N is, she’s not returning my texts.” He asks casually. Howie swallows hard, clearly struggling.

“I think um, she was busy this afternoon.” Howie replies to his shoes.

“Busy?” Nat asks.

“Mhm.” Howie nods. “Well I should go. I have a few things to do.” He jerks his thumb back towards his car.

“Hey,” Buck steps forward “is that a visitor sticker?” He lifts the open edge of Howie’s jacket.

“Oh that’s, that’s old.” Howie scrambles. Nat yanks the sticker off, reading it over.

“Howard it’s dated today.” Buck looks from the sticker to Howie. Howie shifts, guilt washing over his face.

“With Y/N’s name under patient.” Nat turns the sticker around showing Howie.

“Crap, she’s going to kill me.” Howie groans.

“What’s wrong with her, Howie.” Steve pleads. Nat pulls him into the house, Buck kicks the door shut and he’s trapped instantly with them.

“Medical stay. You stay, we test meds, get you feeling good enough to go home again.” He nods.

“Shit.” You groan. “We have to detox.” You grumble. It was your least favorite part of changing meds. It was going through withdrawal, mood swings, all the symptoms you had of your illness would come back in full swing and your only choice was to hang on and ride it out.

“Yes, you have to start fresh. Plus we know some that work best for you already.” He smiles softly.

“Alright.” You sigh. “I just need stuff from home.” You look over at your brother. He was practically beaming with joy. You wanted to slap him, but you understood.

“I’ll pack a bag.” He nods, grinning at you. “By the time I’m back, you’ll be admitted, in your room and we can have dinner together.” He grabs hold of your hand.

title: Forgotten
body:
Fandom: Marvel

Pairing: Loki Laufeyson/Reader

Summary: Loki waits for your return. Fluff.

Word Count: 1k+

Warning(s): None

-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-

      The relatively still atmosphere of the Avenger’s compound is thrown into turmoil as the quinjet makes to land on the helipad. Crisp leaves are pushed towards the edge of the platform and off into the grass in heaps of flurries, and the rhythmic sound of the blades rotating bounces off the sheer glass and concrete of Stark’s design. At the thought of you bouncing your knee inside, battle armor surely strapped tight to your chest, Loki tamps down the urge to fidget with the hem of his T-shirt. He glances over to his brother and the remaining Avengers, and only confirms his suspicion that it’s too late for him to change out of his casual wear and into something more appropriate without any of them noticing.

The conversation between Banner and the witch has long since died down with the approach of the aircraft; Thor, however, trudges ever bravely on and continues with his attempt to forge a conversation between him and his brother, who has long since stopped listening. The jet wobbles on its wings, then finds its balance and touches down gently. Loki links his arms behind his back, feet shoulder width apart, and lifts his chin as the engines cut off. All regal and nonchalant, edges and slopes, Loki puffs his chest and watches diligently for the returning heroes.

He smiles true when you appear from the belly of the beast, stumbling down the quinjet’s ramp battle worn and strong. Your boots are scuffed, hair unkempt, and there’s ash smudged across the left side of your face, running thick along streams of dried sweat and you’re radiant. Valiant. His admiration is only dampened when you don’t immediately look across the helipad for him, search him out with your eager eyes and eager smile, but instead choose to snort and shove the captain off you jokingly, your camaraderie obvious and worrying – and then – Finally. Finally.

Your eyes settle on him, and a dizzying grin breaks across your attractive face. Loki shifts, straightens his posture once more, and his confidence immediately returns, flooding relief through his systems. You pick up your pace, departing from the rest of the group as you head for him.

Thor claps a hand on his shoulder, says something intelligent, then leaves to join his friends; neither you nor Loki pay him any mind.

You call his name like it means the world to you, flash your teeth, and he should have worn his armor. Posing and posturing forgotten, he takes two large steps towards you and meets you halfway. You throw your arms over his shoulders, bouncing up to reach, and he wraps his arms snuggly around your waist, leaning back to pull you up with him in a swooping gesture that never fails to make you laugh. He quickly sets you back down on your feet, and ducks his head down so you’re not balancing on your toes. “How are you?” you mumble into his chest as he slides his hands under your backpack so he can better hold you.

“Fine,” he says, pulling away to woo you with a smile and trace your jawline with his knuckles, a touch barely there, a steady hand on the dip of your waist to compliment.

Stark shouts something aimed at you, and you respond carelessly, without taking your eyes off Loki’s face. He finds warmth there, and can feel a familiar sort of pride well up in his chest, take up residence under his collar – and who wouldn’t be proud? You’ve chosen him, after all. Chosen him to share your affections with, chosen him to hold you, he’d be a fool not to be.

“How are you, darling?” You bud under the term of endearment, just as he knew you would, smile widening and so, so sincere.

“Fine,” you mirror his words, and then add, “better now that I’m with you.” There’s a weariness in your body, he can feel it, feel what you’ve been through and you just keep staring up at him, content to stay and sway and never move another inch for the rest of your life, admiration in your eyes – and it’s in moments like these that Loki’s sure whatever softness he feels for you is returned.

You place a hand on his cheek, curling your fingers so your nails drag lightly across his jaw and press yourself up ever so slightly, lips parting, and his thoughts become unorganized and non-verbal as you pull him closer, and –

Stark wretches comically behind you, loud and obnoxious enough for you to jump in his arms and knock your forehead against his.

Rhodes enables his friend with uncontrollable laughter.

Loki feels embarrassment and anger grip him tight and jerk him from you. You drop your head to his chest with an exhausted huff, and try to fold yourself into his arms. And before anybody can do anything, Thor is smacking the back of Stark’s head hard enough to send the man stumbling forward, voice like thunder as he reprimands the billionaire.

“Let’s just go,” you sigh, fatigue corroding your normally good will and how dare Stark be so unkind towards you, his distaste for Loki set aside. You’re obviously exhausted, barely standing on your own two feet and you’ve obviously chosen him to return to. Loki feels indignation well up, but he keeps it on a leash for your sake, and quickly teleports the both of you to your quarters. With the flick of his hand, the shower starts, and steam begins to pour out of the attached bathroom. You give him a weak smile as you place your heart in his hands.

Loki disrobes you slowly, hands on course as he methodically unlatches and undoes your armor, and then he’s tugging your shirt free from your pants. You laugh lightly at the pull, leaning towards him with your hands on his biceps to steady yourself.

He pushes you into the bathroom, air heavy and hot, the tile cold underfoot, and you’re grateful. And you love him and you love him and you love him so, so, so much. You tell him so, murmuring the words into the hollow of his throat as he smooths his palms over your shoulders and scrubs the last two weeks off your back.

Everything else is forgotten, everything else is forgiven.

-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-

He finds warmth there, and can feel a familiar sort of pride well up in his chest, take up residence under his collar – and who wouldn’t be proud? You’ve chosen him, after all. Chosen him to share your affections with, chosen him to hold you, he’d be a fool not to be.

“How are you, darling?” You bud under the term of endearment, just as he knew you would, smile widening and so, so sincere.

“Fine,” you mirror his words, and then add, “better now that I’m with you.” There’s a weariness in your body, he can feel it, feel what you’ve been through and you just keep staring up at him, content to stay and sway and never move another inch for the rest of your life, admiration in your eyes – and it’s in moments like these that Loki’s sure whatever softness he feels for you is returned.

You place a hand on his cheek, curling your fingers so your nails drag lightly across his jaw and press yourself up ever so slightly, lips parting, and his thoughts become unorganized and non-verbal as you pull him closer, and –

Stark wretches comically behind you, loud and obnoxious enough for you to jump in his arms and knock your forehead against his.

Rhodes enables his friend with uncontrollable laughter.

Loki feels embarrassment and anger grip him tight and jerk him from you. You drop your head to his chest with an exhausted huff, and try to fold yourself into his arms. And before anybody can do anything, Thor is smacking the back of Stark’s head hard enough to send the man stumbling forward, voice like thunder as he reprimands the billionaire.

“Let’s just go,” you sigh, fatigue corroding your normally good will and how dare Stark be so unkind towards you, his distaste for Loki set aside. You’re obviously exhausted, barely standing on your own two feet and you’ve obviously chosen him to return to. Loki feels indignation well up, but he keeps it on a leash for your sake, and quickly teleports the both of you to your quarters. With the flick of his hand, the shower starts, and steam begins to pour out of the attached bathroom. You give him a weak smile as you place your heart in his hands.

Loki disrobes you slowly, hands on course as he methodically unlatches and undoes your armor, and then he’s tugging your shirt free from your pants. You laugh lightly at the pull, leaning towards him with your hands on his biceps to steady yourself.

He pushes you into the bathroom, air heavy and hot, the tile cold underfoot, and you’re grateful. And you love him and you love him and you love him so, so, so much. You tell him so, murmuring the words into the hollow of his throat as he smooths his palms over your shoulders and scrubs the last two weeks off your back.

Everything else is forgotten, everything else is forgiven.

At the thought of you bouncing your knee inside, battle armor surely strapped tight to your chest, Loki tamps down the urge to fidget with the hem of his T-shirt. He glances over to his brother and the remaining Avengers, and only confirms his suspicion that it’s too late for him to change out of his casual wear and into something more appropriate without any of them noticing.
